diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Malignant paraganglioma associated with SDHD (D92Y) mutations
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The study reported cases of five patients with SDHD (D92Y) mutations who developed malignant paragangliomas, demonstrating significant interindividual variability in clinical presentation. Malignancy was confirmed through evidence of metastasis and/or local tumor invasion, as illustrated by different manifestations such as bone metastases and lymph node involvement. Furthermore, the presence of catecholamine excess, particularly in four patients, supported the diagnosis.
